entity1.name: Tattoos
entity1.description: A form of body art and self-expression that has been practiced for centuries, with varying cultural significance across different societies and time periods.

entity2.name: tattoos
entity2.description: A form of body modification where designs are inked into the skin, often used as symbols of identity, belonging, and ritual in various cultures.

entity3.name: tattoos
entity3.description: A form of body modification where designs are created by inserting ink into the skin.

entity4.name: Polynesian cultures
entity4.description: A group of indigenous peoples and their associated cultural practices originating from the Polynesian islands in the Pacific Ocean.

entity5.name: tattoos
entity5.description: Permanent designs or marks made on the skin by injecting pigment into the dermis layer, often used for decorative, cultural, or symbolic purposes.

entity6.name: Maori
entity6.description: The indigenous Polynesian people of New Zealand, known for their rich cultural heritage and traditions.

entity7.name: moko
entity7.description: A traditional form of tattoo in Maori culture that signifies a person's lineage, tribal affiliations, and life story.

entity8.name: tattoos
entity8.description: A form of body modification involving the creation of designs on the skin, often used for self-expression and identity formation.

entity9.name: Western societies
entity9.description: Refers to the collective of countries and cultures primarily found in Europe, North America, and other regions influenced by Western traditions.

entity10.name: tattoos

entity11.name: nature

entity12.name: mythology

entity14.name: indigenous cultures
entity14.description: Refers to the traditional and native societies that have historical continuity with pre-invasion or pre-colonial societies, often maintaining distinct social, cultural, and economic characteristics.

entity15.name: tattoos

entity17.name: Japan

entity20.name: natural world

entity21.name: Samoan culture
entity21.description: The traditional practices and beliefs of the Samoan people, including social norms, customs, and rituals.

entity22.name: pe'a
entity22.description: A traditional Samoan tattoo that is a significant cultural symbol for young men, marking their transition into adulthood and commitment to the community.

entity23.name: pe'a
entity23.description: A traditional Samoan tattoo that carries significant cultural and personal meaning, reflecting the wearer's family lineage, achievements, and personal values.
